abstract: The financial industry, which in recent years reaped disastrous results from its exposure to bad mortgages, is once again dipping its toe into subprime waters.
snippet: The financial industry, which in recent years reaped disastrous results from its exposure to bad mortgages, is once again dipping its toe into subprime waters.
lead_paragraph: The financial industry, which in recent years reaped disastrous results from its exposure to bad mortgages, is once again dipping its toe into subprime waters. Capital One, GM Financial and JPMorgan Chase are among those now courting some risky borrowers, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Tara Siegel Bernard report in The New York Times. Read more »
